The Spurs defeated the Bulls 104-96. NOTE TO ... more Image 15 of 15 'Jimmer Mania' no more in San Antonio 1 / 15 Back to Gallery “Jimmer Mania” is no more in San Antonio.
The Spurs are set to make veteran shooting guard Jimmer Fredette one of their first cuts of training camp, the Express-News has confirmed through NBA sources.
RELATED : Spurs burned by Suns in penultimate preseason game
The team will eat $507,000 in guaranteed money to let loose Fredette, who appeared in only three of the Spurs’ five preseason games and made 2 of 10 field goal tries.
RELATED : Duncan passes the torch to Aldridge on Sports Illustrated cover
The Spurs must make four more cuts to trim their roster to the league-mandated 15 by Monday’s deadline. Yahoo! Sports was the first to report Fredette’s impending dismissal.
For more on Fredette’s short time with the Spurs, click here.
